Alaris.Irc.Connection Class Reference

This class manages the connection to the IRC server and provides access to all the objects needed to send and receive messages. More...

Detailed Description

This class manages the connection to the IRC server and provides access to all the objects needed to send and receive messages.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Alaris.Irc.Connection.Connection ( ConnectionArgs  args,
bool  enableCtcp,
bool  enableDcc 
)

Prepare a connection to an IRC server but do not open it. This sets the text Encoding to Default.

Parameters:
args The set of information need to connect to an IRC server
enableCtcp True if this Connection should support CTCP.
enableDcc True if this Connection should support DCC.

Prepare a connection to an IRC server but do not open it.

enableCtcp True if this Connection should support CTCP.
enableDcc True if this Connection should support DCC.
textEncoding The text encoding for the incoming stream.

Member Function Documentation

void Alaris.Irc.Connection.AddParser ( IParser  parser  ) 

Adds a parser class to a list of custom parsers. Any number can be added. The custom parsers will be tested using CanParse() before the default parsers. The last parser to be added will be the first to process a message.

Parameters:
parser Any class that implements IParser.
void Alaris.Irc.Connection.Connect (  ) 

Connect to the IRC server and start listening for messages on a new thread.

Exceptions:
SocketException If a connection cannot be established with the IRC server
void Alaris.Irc.Connection.Disconnect ( string  reason  ) 

Sends a 'Quit' message to the server, closes the connection, and stops the listening thread.

The state of the connection will remain the same even after a disconnect, so the connection can be reopened. All the event handlers will remain registered.

Parameters:
reason A message displayed to IRC users upon disconnect.

Property Documentation

bool Alaris.Irc.Connection.Connected [get]

A read-only property indicating whether a connection has been opened with the IRC server (but not whether registration has succeeded).

True if the client is connected.

ConnectionArgs Alaris.Irc.Connection.ConnectionData [get]

The collection of data used to establish this connection.

Read only ConnectionArgs.

CtcpListener Alaris.Irc.Connection.CtcpListener [get]

The object that parses CTCP messages and notifies the appropriate delegate.

Read only CtcpListener. Null if CtcpEnabled is false.

CtcpResponder Alaris.Irc.Connection.CtcpResponder [get, set]

Sets an automatic responder to Ctcp queries.

Once this is set it can be removed by setting it to null.

CtcpSender Alaris.Irc.Connection.CtcpSender [get]

The object used to send CTCP commands to the IRC server.

Read only CtcpSender. Null if CtcpEnabled is false.

bool Alaris.Irc.Connection.EnableCtcp [get, set]

Whether Ctcp commands should be processed and if Ctcp events will be raised.

True will enable the CTCP sender and listener and false will cause their property calls to return null.

bool Alaris.Irc.Connection.EnableDcc [get, set]

Whether DCC requests should be processed or ignored by this Connection. Since the DccListener is a singleton and shared by all Connections, listeners to DccListener events should be manually removed when no longer needed.

True to process DCC requests.

bool Alaris.Irc.Connection.HandleNickTaken [get, set]

By default the connection itself will handle the case where, while attempting to register the client's nick is already in use. It does this by simply appending 2 random numbers to the end of the nick.

The NickError event is shows that the nick collision has happened and it is fixed by calling Sender's Register() method passing in the replacement nickname.

True if the connection should handle this case and false if the client will handle it itself.

TimeSpan Alaris.Irc.Connection.IdleTime [get]

The amount of time that has passed since the client sent a command to the IRC server.

Read only TimeSpan

Listener Alaris.Irc.Connection.Listener [get]

The object that parses messages and notifies the appropriate delegate.

Read only Listener.

string Alaris.Irc.Connection.Name [get]

A user friendly name of this Connection in the form 'nick'.

Read only string

bool Alaris.Irc.Connection.Registered [get]

A read-only property indicating whether the connection has been opened with the IRC server and the client has been successfully registered.

True if the client is connected and registered.

Sender Alaris.Irc.Connection.Sender [get]

The object used to send commands to the IRC server.

Read-only Sender.

ServerProperties Alaris.Irc.Connection.ServerProperties [get]

A read-only collection of string key/value pairs representing IRC server proprties.

This connection's ServerProperties obejct or null if it has not been created.

Encoding Alaris.Irc.Connection.TextEncoding [get, set]

Sets the text encoding used by the read and write streams. Must be set before Connect() is called and should not be changed while the connection is processing messages.

An Encoding constant.

Event Documentation

RawMessageReceivedEventHandler Alaris.Irc.Connection.OnRawMessageReceived

Receive all the messages, unparsed, sent by the IRC server. This is not normally needed but provided for those who are interested.

RawMessageSentEventHandler Alaris.Irc.Connection.OnRawMessageSent

Receive all the raw messages sent to the IRC from this connection.
